frame.name: Placing
frame.definition:
<def-root>Generally without overall (translational) motion, an <fen>Agent</fen> places a <fen>Theme</fen> at a location, the <fen>Goal</fen>, which is profiled. In this frame, the <fen>Theme</fen> is under the control of the <fen>Agent</fen>/<fen>Cause</fen> at the time of its arrival at the <fen>Goal</fen>. <ex><fex name="Agent">David</fex> <t>placed</t> <fex name="Theme">his briefcase</fex> <fex name="Goal">on the floor</fex>.</ex>
This frame differs from Filling in that it focuses on the <fen>Theme</fen> rather than the effect on the <fen>Goal</fen> entity. It differs from Removing in focusing on the <fen>Goal</fen> rather than the <fen>Source</fen> of motion for the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
<ex><fex name="Agent">The waiter</fex> <t>placed</t> the food on the table.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes location during the Placing.
<ex>The waiter <t>placed</t> <fex name="Theme">the food</fex> on the table.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the <fen>Theme</fen>, before it changes location. <ex>Her mother <t>shelved</t> the cans <fex name="Src">from the countertop</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>. In this frame, <fen>Path</fen> expressions almost always have a <ment>via</ment>-sense.
<ex>The mail carrier <t>stuck</t> the letters <fex name="Path">through the slot</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up. This FE is profiled by words in this frame. <ex>The waiter <t>placed</t> the food <fex name="Goal">on the table</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any expression which describes a property of the placing action which is not directly related to the trajectory of the <fen>Theme</fen>'s motion expresses the frame element <fen>Manner</fen>. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions.
<ex>The chef <t>packaged</t> the food <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex> into take-out containers.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> indicates the degree to which the placing occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Theme</fen> of the placing.
<ex>I <t>put</t> the dishes into the cabinet <fex name="Depictive">unwashed</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is an act whereby the <fen>Agent</fen> achieves the placing of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>The Egyptians <t>set</t> it in place <fex name="Mns">by simple levering</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of the Placing.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Duration</fen> is the amount of time for which the <fen>Theme</fen> is to stay in the <fen>Goal</fen> location.
<ex>If you <t>place</t> it there <fex name="Duration">for extended periods</fex>, your monitor may suffer permanent damage.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the Placing occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> indicates why the Placing occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Time</fen> is when the Placing occurs
<ex>Smithers had <t>placed</t> the table there <fex name="Time">the night before</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Area
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Area</fen> is the setting into which the <fen>Theme</fen> is placed.
<ex>She emptied a wash basket full of towels and <t>deposited</t> them <fex name="Area">around the house</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cotheme
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique.
<ex>Pat <t>lay</t> the trophy on the mantle <fex name="Cotheme">along with her portrait</fex>. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion.
<ex>I <t>plunged</t> my hands <fex name="Distance">wrist deep</fex> in the fragrant herbs and rubbed the dry fragments between the fingertips</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speed
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> is the rate at which Placing occurs.
<ex>Smithers <t>put</t> his book down <fex name="Speed">quickly</fex> and turned around.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root><ex>Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is <fex name="Cause">another plant which</fex> <t>puts</t> nitrogen into the soil .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by perform the placing action.
<ex>They <t>put</t> the vase in a box <fex name="Purpose">to protect it during transportation</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>This extrathematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: deposit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put or set down in a specific place.

lexUnit.name: embed.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: fix firmly and deeply in a surrounding mass

lexUnit.name: hang.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: suspend or be suspended from above with the lower part not attached.

lexUnit.name: immerse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: dip or submerge in a liquid.

lexUnit.name: implant.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: insert or fix (tissue or an artificial object) into the body

lexUnit.name: inject.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: introduce (a liquid, especially a drug or vaccine) into the body with a syringe

lexUnit.name: insert.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place, fit, or incorporate (something) in something else

lexUnit.name: insertion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the placing, fitting, or incorporating of (something) in something else

lexUnit.name: lay.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place or fix (equipment) in position ready for use.

lexUnit.name: lean.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: incline from the perpendicular and rest against.

lexUnit.name: load.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put a load on or in (a vehicle, ship, etc.).

lexUnit.name: lodge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become firmly fixed in a place.

lexUnit.name: pack.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: to place in a container for transport or storage

lexUnit.name: park.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deposit or leave in a convenient place until required

lexUnit.name: pile.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place (things) one on top of the other

lexUnit.name: place.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put in a particular position

lexUnit.name: placement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or fact of placing or being placed

lexUnit.name: plant.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place (a seed, bulb, or plant) in the ground so that it can grow.

lexUnit.name: position.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put or arrange in a particular position.

lexUnit.name: rest.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place or be placed so as to stay in a specified position

lexUnit.name: set.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put, lay, or stand (something) in a specified place or position

lexUnit.name: situate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place in a particular location or context

lexUnit.name: smear.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: spread (a greasy or sticky substance) over a surface

lexUnit.name: stand.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: place in a particular position

lexUnit.name: stash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: store safely in a secret place.

lexUnit.name: stow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pack or store (an object) tidily in an appropriate place.

lexUnit.name: stuff.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: force tightly into a receptacle or space.

lexUnit.name: tuck.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: put into a snug place

lexUnit.name: wrap.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: arrange (paper or soft material) round something, as a covering or for warmth or protection.

lexUnit.name: bag.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put in a bag

lexUnit.name: billet.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: lodge (soldiers) in a civilian house

lexUnit.name: bin.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: a. throw (something) away by putting it in a bin.

lexUnit.name: bottle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place in bottles for storage

lexUnit.name: archive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place in an archive

lexUnit.name: box.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put in ... a box

lexUnit.name: cage.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: confine in or as in a cage

lexUnit.name: crate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pack in a crate for transportation

lexUnit.name: file.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place (a document) in a file

lexUnit.name: garage.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put or keep (a motor vehicle) in a garage.

lexUnit.name: pocket.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put into one's pocket

lexUnit.name: shelve.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place on a shelf

lexUnit.name: stable.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put [or keep] a horse in a stable

lexUnit.name: perch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: set or balance someone or something on

lexUnit.name: sit.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to sit or be placed (somewhere)

lexUnit.name: daub.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: spread (a thick substance) on a surface [carelessly or liberally]

lexUnit.name: drizzle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: pour (liquid) in a thin stream

lexUnit.name: dab.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: apply (a substance) with light quick strokes

lexUnit.name: drape.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to put an object or objects loosely on or around an object

lexUnit.name: brush.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: apply with a brush

lexUnit.name: dust.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: apply (a powdered substance) lightly to a surface

lexUnit.name: heap.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put in or form a heap

lexUnit.name: jam.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: squeeze or pack tightly into a space, sometimes with force

lexUnit.name: rub.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: apply with a rubbing action

lexUnit.name: cram.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: force too many (people or things) into a container

lexUnit.name: shower.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: pour or throw (a liquid or other substance) in a shower

lexUnit.name: pot.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: plant in a pot

lexUnit.name: sheathe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put (a knife or sword) into a sheath

lexUnit.name: warehouse.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: place in a warehouse.

lexUnit.name: shoulder.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to support or carry on or as if on the shoulder(s)

lexUnit.name: stick.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. and adverbial of place put somewhere in a quick or careless way.

lexUnit.name: bestow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: [archaic] put (something) in a specified place.

lexUnit.name: put.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move to or place in a particular position.

lexUnit.name: package.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put into a box or wrapping.

lexUnit.name: plunge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: push or thrust something quickly.

lexUnit.name: arrange.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: put in order on or against a background

lexUnit.name: emplace.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: set in a position.

lexUnit.name: enclose.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: insert inside a container

lexUnit.name: implanted.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: an idea or object put into a person

lexUnit.name: gag.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to place an object (usually a piece of cloth) over someone's mouth
